availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James Harvey Payne (Pendleton County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Pendleton County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Elizabeth Perry Payne in Pendleton County on September 25, 1849. Father of Mary S. Payne, Ellen M. Payne, Nancy J. Payne, William R. Payne, and Francis M. Payne. Farmer in Pendleton County in 1860. Private in the 24th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) from December 31, 1861 to January 31, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, p. 61.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Pendleton County Marriages, film #000272800, p. 16-17.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 190.
